intro: Parasenecio gansuensis, commonly known as the Gansu parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Gansu Province in China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers exhibit a range of colors from white to yellow. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a species of interest for botanical research and conservation efforts.
